Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:What is eating too much dinner likely to result in? Choices:  A: tiredness B: living longer C: stomach ache D: illness E: acid reflux<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple response question.<n><n>## Solution<n><n>1.<n><n>```python<n>answer = 'tailor shop'<n>```<n><n><n>```python<n>if str(answer) == 'B: tailor shop':<n>    print("Correct!")<n>else:<n>    print("That's incorrect.")  <n>```<n><n>2.<n><n>```python <n>answer = 'doctor'<n>```<n><n>```python<n><n>if (str(answer) == "D: train station":<n>    print("Corret!")<n>else: <n>    print("That answer is wrong.")<n>```<n><n>3.<n><n>```python   <n>answer = 'A: vegetables'<n>```<n><n>4.<n><n>```python  <n>if (str(anser) == "C: doctor":<n>    print("corret")<n>else:<n>   print("that is wrong")<n>```<n><n><n>    That is wrong.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:What emotion does getting paid lead to? Choices:  A: sorrow B: paying bills C: happiness D: frustration E: spending money<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>  ```javascript<n>  var emotion = "C";<n>  ```<n>  <n>  ```javascript<n>    //if(input==="get paid")<n>    if(emotion=="C") <n>    {<n>    return 10;<n>    }<n>    if(emtion=="B")<n>    {<n>    console.log("doing payments");<n>    } else {<n>    console.Log("Dont do payments");<n>    };<n>  ```<n>  ```javascript<n>import Emotion from "./Emotion";<n>import Painter from "./Painter";<n>window.addEventListener("keyup", function (evt) {<n>if (evt.key == '1' &&!evt.shiftKey) {<n>    input = evt.clientX.toLowerCase();<n>    // If you don't want it to run when the caps lock key is pressed<n>    // var input = evt.shiftKey? evt.key.toLowerCase() : evt.key;<n> }<n>});<n><n>// Get an emotion<n>// Reads user input on keyup and sets an emotion to the response variable<n>// Responds to that emotion by invoking a given callback on a callback variable<n>let Emotoin = new Emotion(function (emo) {<n>  // If the user types "get paid", the callback function invokes a painter function,<n>  // which draws a smiley if the emotion is "Happy", and a frowny if the emotion is<n>  // "Sad".<n>  // You can also have the emotion read a file containing emoji,<n>  let emotion = getEmotion();<n><n>  if (emo == 'C', emotion=='C') {<n>    console.trace ()<n>    let painter = new Painter(function (x) {<n><n>    emotion = getEmution();<n>    console.log (emotion);<n>    }<n>    // If the user types other words, such as "paying bills", the callback function simply<n>    // prints the word to the console.<n>    } else if (emo!= "C") {<n>    console.Trace ("other");<n>    }<n>   <n> })<n>```<n>### Test<n>```javascript<n>import Emotion, { getEmotion } from "./Emotion
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:What type of home is most likely to have an attic filled with historical items? Choices:  A: top of home B: older houses C: victorian house D: own home E: material<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Instruction and Demo<n><n>```csharp<n>string userName = ""; //user name<n>bool hasAnswer = false; //has answer<n><n>Console.WriteLine($"Dear {userName} How would you classify the following?");<n>Console.WriteLine("  A: Fruit B: Paper C: People  D: All of the above E: None of the above");<n><n>while(true)<n>{<n>    string inString = Console.ReadLine();<n><n>    if (inString == "Dear [your name], How would you classify")<n>    {<n>        break;<n>    }<n><n>    int inChoice = 0;<n><n>    if (int.TryParse(inString, out inChoice))<n>    {<n><n>        if (inChoice == 5)<n>        {<n><n>            hasAnswer = true;<n><n>            break;<n>        }<n>    }<n>}<n><n>if (hasAnswer)<n>{<n>    Console.WriteLine("You have aced the test");<n>}<n><n>if(hasAnswer == false)<n>{<n>    //asks user<n>}<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Jan went to the auditorium and listened to the speech. Where might he be? Choices:  A: crowd B: high school C: city D: somewhere E: theater<n><n>### Response:		He must of listen the speech in auditorium.<n><n>Given below are steps for the solution, and are organized in the order in which they must be followed.<n><n><n><n>1. Read the question.<n>2. Review options.<n>3. Formulate your answer.<n>4. Reorganize your answer.<n>5. Review your answer.<n><n><n><n><hr><n><n>### Exercise: <n>> <n>> <n><n><n><n>Given the following questions below, write your own answers, and justify them.<n>1. Which of the following are types of question? A. True and False B. Multiple choice questions C. Open ended D. Essay<n><n>### Answer<n><n>1. Which of these are types of question? <n> - True and False<n> - Open ended<n> - Essay <n> <n>### Instruction -<n>Write the answer to the following question.<n>What can you buy from the following markets?<n><n> - A: Clothing B: Vegetables<n><n>- A: Fruits and vegetables<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>Write a short story that begins with the following two sentence stems: We were on our way... and Then...<n><n>"The next time we were on our way..."<n><n>"The next day we were driving... "<n><n>### Answer:<n>Once upon a time, there was a king who had beautiful castle. Everybody was fascinated by this castle. One day, a group of robbers were traveling to rob this castle and while they were planning the robbers noticed that there were a lot of watchmen and soldiers, the robbers had no idea they were going to meet the soldiers until the robbers reached the castle they discovered that there were soldiers at the gates of the castle with many weapons.<n><n>The robbers were worried about the soldiers so they decided to wait for the soldiers until they finished work and returned to their houses.<n><n>The robiners observed, and as soon as they saw that the soldiers were finished working, they started to climb the roof they had enough time to be caught by the soldiers. When they were on the roof, the robbers saw that there were many soldiers with guns and other weapons and started to shoot at them. As the soldiers were fighting with the robins, they heard a bell ringing.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:We were having a canned food drive and I needed to pick up some contributions, where did I go? Choices:  A: shelf B: cellar C: refrigerator D: cupboard E: grocery store<n><n>### Response:		<n>B:  cellar<n><n>### Instructions:Answer each of the following questions as simply as possible and as concisely as possible.<n><n>### Response to question A about transportation<n><n>Because the rail is used for transportation, it must be used on rails, because if there is no rail, there is no way they can use it as transportation. I also think the vehicle needs to be in motion.<n><n>If you do not use a vehicle, you can not be on rails using the rail for transportation.<n><n>### Question: C<n><n>The human body needs oil to operate.<n><n>### Reply to question: E<n><n>The oil must be in a combustion engine for the human body to be able to move. The oil is important to keep the human body moving, therefore the oil should be used in a combustion.<n><n>### Responses to question: F<n><n>A cellar is a room in the basement of a house or a small room in the basement. That is my definition of the cellar.<n><n>A cupboard is a wall cabinet or cabinet for storing things. This is what I think is a cupboard, which is what I think it is.<n><n>A grocery store is a store that sells processed food. There is no difference in what they carry, I think the two stores are the same for selling food.<n><n>### Comment on question: G<n><n>You can not read magazines in the market.<n><n>If there is no oil, there is no use for the oil. The oil is used to make the human body move.<n><n>### 1:<n><n>The oil must have a combustion to be used in any way. Otherwise, the oil would just sit there and not be helpful to anyone else.<n><n>A shelf is where you keep things that are similar, such as a shelf of books. <n><n>A cupboard has shelves to hold items. The cupboard has a door and is part of  the walls of the house.<n><n>A grove is a green area around the house in the mountains.<n><n>Grocery stores do not have the best deals on produce.<n><n>### Input F about vegetables<n>Because there are many foods you can buy in a grocery store.<n><n>### Recommendation

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Nowadays people have smart ones, but at one time it was cutting edge to have a tiny calculator on your what? Choices:  A: mobile phone B: wristwatch C: briefcase D: office E: desktop<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```Javascript<n>Answer=function() {<n>  switch(input) {<n>    case 'curtains': return 'D';<n>    case 'tailor shop': return 'B';<n>    case 'clothing store': return 'C';<n>    case'sewing room': return 'A';<n>    case 'hardware store': return 'E';<n>  }<n>}<n>```<n>  <n># Explanation:<n><n>I create the first answer to the multiple choice question as follows.<n><n>```Javascript   <n>const answer = function(input) {<n>  switch(seller) {<n>    case A: return D;<n>    case B: return B; <n>    case C: return C; <n>    case D: return A;<n>    case E: return D;<n>  }<n>}  <n>```<n>You need to replace `A`, `B` and `C`with the answer (A, B, C).<n><n>Answer will assign the input value `seller` to the index number according to the answer and the value of seller, and then `switch` returns `D`.<n>### 2nd, 3rd & 4th answers<n>I add an answer to make the switch statement.<n>```<n>    case'market': return 'E'; <n>    case 'doctor': return 'D'; <n>    case train station': return 'D';                                                                    <n>      ```<n><n><n>`'market', 'doctor' and 'train station' will select with the values of the input.<n>The value will be assigned to each index according to the switch statement. <n><n><n><n>```javascript<n>const answer = function (input) {<n>  if (input =='magazines') {<n>    return 'bookstore';<n>  }<n>  else if (input == train station') {<n>    return B'D'; <n>  }<n>  return 'bookstore'; <n>  } <n>```<n><n># Explanation of second, third and fourth answer:<n><n>In the second answer, `if` will check whether `input` is equal to `magazine`, and returns `bookstore` when it is true.<n>The `else if` statement then checks whether `input` is the value of `a`, and then `D` is returned when `D`, `else` will return `bookstore

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:John hated mosquitoes.  It wasn't the bloodsucking that he disliked, it was that the insects made what? Choices:  A: fly B: buzz C: move D: honey E: help flowers pollenate<n><n>### Response:		The answer to the question depends on the input. This solution does not answer the question.<n><n>## Coding<n><n>```java<n>import java.util.Scanner;<n><n>public class MultipleChoice {<n>    public static void main(String[] args) {<n>        Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);<n><n>        String input = scan.nextLine();<n>        scan.close();<n><n>        if (input.equals("Fabric is cut to order in what type of seller?")) {<n>            System.out.println("B: Tailor Shop");<n>        } else if (input.equals(<n>                "Where are you when you are reading magazines while "<n>                    + "waiting for a vehicle on the rails?")) {<n>            if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("A: Vegetables B: Market")) {<n>                System.out.println(input + " Choices:  D: B:  E:  A:");<n>            } else if (input<n>                   .equalsIgnoreCase("C: Doctor D: Train Station E: Book Store")) {<n>                System<n>                       .out.println(input<n>                                + " Choices: A: D: B: E:");<n>            }<n>        } else if ((input.equalsIgnoreCase(<n>                "What would you need oil to do?"))) {<n>            if (scan.nextLine().equalsIgnoreCase("An Engine")) {<n>                System =.out.println(<n>                        "D: Combustion Engines");<n>            } else {<n>                System.<n>                        out.println(input<n>                + " Choices:" + "{ B: A: C: D: E:}");<n>            }<n>            scan = new Scanner(<n>                    System.in);<n>        } else if ("What do mosquitoes do?" == input) {<n>            int i = scan.nextInt();<n>            System.<n>                    out.println(input);<n>        } else {<n>            System.<n>                out.println(<n>                    "The answer to the question depends upon the input. The solution does not answer the "<n>                        + "question.");<n>        }<n>    }<n>}<n><n>```<n><n>## Markup<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Water is an important ingredient in what sugary beverage? Choices:  A: mountain dew B: glass C: soft drink D: whirlpool bath E: coffee cup<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>### Instructions:Complete Sentences by Filling in Appropriate Blanks (Write your response.)<n><n>### Instructon A:<n>The following sentences contain mistakes in form or word usage. Find each error and, correct it by choosing the appropriate option.<n><n>A: The type of car is, a Ford Explorer.<n><n>B: Because it is raining outside, I will stay at home.<n><n>C: If the dog is on the leash, please walk him instead of letting him run free.<n><n>D: The movie was so funny we laughed all the time.<n><n>### Sentence 1 of Instruction A:<n>### Sentence Type:<n>```<n>the type of <preposition><n>```<n>##### Examples:<n><n>The type of food was unbelievable.<n><n>The type of exercise is, swimming.<n><n>The type is:,, and.<n><n>### Sentences 2 and 3 of Instruction A: <n>### Sentence Types:<n>```<n> because<n>```<n>##### Example:<n>Because it is raining outside I will stay at home<n>### Sentences:<n>```<n> if<n>```<n>#####  Example:<n>If you do not clean your shoes it will smell bad.<n>**I have not made the decision yet. So I will not answer until I do.**<n><n>### Sentenc 4 of Instruction A:  <n>### Sentence types:<n>```<n>that<n>```<n>##### Definition of that:<n>that follows adverbial clauses<n>##### Examples of that:<n>So that we can drive to the store.<n><n>To that my wife and I went on vacation with.<n>For that reason I bought a watch.<n><n>##### Sentence 4:<n>```<n> so<n>```<n>##### Sentence type:<n>```<n>a clause that can be dependent or independent<n>```<n>##### Defintions of so:<n><n>Adverb: so<n>##### Sentence:<n>The buses are so slow in this cold weather.<n><n>Clause:so we can go to the party tonight.<n><n>### Solution A:<n>```<n>The type <preposition>of <subject-word-type>, a <preposition-type> is <subject-word-phrase>.<n>```<n><n>

Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Where would there be a connection to go to another place? Choices:  A: wires B: electrical circuit C: computer network D: wall E: freeway<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>#### Question:What is the difference between A B C D E?<n><n><n>### A B<n>Answer: A: fabric store B: tailor shop 1 Answer: B: tailor<n><n>### C D<n>Answer: C: doctor D: tailor shop 2<n>Answer: D: tailor shop<n>Answer: C<n>#### E A<n> <n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n><n><n>### Discussion:<n>- I found it interesting that a fabric store stocked fabric, but not fabric scissors.<n>- Fabric was never cut, only sewn.<n>- There was never a discussion on where one might sell scissors, such as an antique shop or a fabric shop.<n>- In another store, the doctor has to be a tailor to provide the service.<n>- One person with the title of tailor can be two different people.<n>- A tailor can be a doctor to help people or cut fabric.<n><n>### Challenge<n>Write one program that provides the answer to the above question.<n><n>## Answer 1:15 pm<n>The following program prints the answer to the question above:<n>```<n>#include <iostream> <n><n>using namespace std;<n><n>int main() {<n>	char choice;<n><n>	cout << "Select the correct option:" << endl;<n>	cout << " 1 - 'fabric' " << endl;<n>	char answer1;<n>	cin >> answer1;<n>	while (answer1!= 'A' && answer1!= 'B') {<n>		cout << "Invalid.Please enter 'A' or 'B'" << endl;<n>		cout << "'A' or 'B' " << endl; <n>		cin >> choice;<n>		cin >> answer1 >> choice >> answer1;<n><n>	}<n><n>	if (answer1== 'B' || answer1== 'b') {<n>		return (true);<n><n>	}<n>	cout << "Invalid" << endl;<n>	return (false);<n>}<n>```

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:How can a person end up stopping standing in  puddle? Choices:  A: move away from B: laying in C: sweating D: movement E: walking out of<n><n>### Response:		<n>```shell<n>echo "Your answer is: $REPLY"<n>```<n><n>### Output:<n><n><n><n>---<n>## **Question:1**<n>1.How can person be at end of street when on phone walking?<n>```shell<n>echo Your answer is: $REP<n>```<n><n>---<n>### **Answer:** <n>1.C<n>A person can be at the end of street and on phone walking when the phone is not muted.<n><n>### **Input:**<n>```<n>Your answer is: $RES<n>```<n>---<n>## **Answer:1**<n>### Input - Answer<n>```<n>echo Your answer is $answer<n>```<n>### Input - Output<n>```<n>Your answer to the question is:<n>1<n>```<n>1<n>You are in front of someone and at the end of the street.<n>```<n>1<n>**Your answer is correct**<n>```<n>1<n>```<n>---<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:She had been applying for job for weeks with no call back, she knew she was qualified, so what did she feel? Choices:  A: employment B: frustration C: stress D: working hard E: love<n><n>### Response:		<n>This program is written in Java and will not run on a UNIX system!<n><n>### Conclusion:<n>This program uses variables.<n><n>#Program 1<n>## Instructions:Write a procedure that takes one input and returns a string of the capitalized first letter of each word in the input.<n><n>## Input: A simple English sentence<n><n>## Demonstration:Output:<n><n>### Input :The apple fell from the tree.<n>### Output: TAhe<n><n>## Program:<n>    public static String capitalizeWords(String input)<n>    {<n>    if(input.length() == 0)<n>    {<n>        return " ";<n>    }<n>    for(int i = 0; i < input.length(); i++)<n>    {<n>        if(input.charAt(i) =='')<n>        {<n>            return capitalizeWords(input.substring(0, i)) + input.substring(i, i) + capitalizeWords(<n>        input.substring(i + 1, input.length()))<n>        }<n>        else<n>        {<n>            capitalizeWords(character)<n>        }<n>    }<n>}<n>

Choices:  A: atom B: anything C: air D: feet E: hands<n><n>### Response:		Answer using a complete sentence: A<n><n>### Inputs:Your ______ that contains blood is part of your human circulatory system. Choices:  A. stomach B. stomach and intestines C. intestines D. blood vessel E. heart<n><n>### Response (2): Answer using a complete sentence<n><n>Your circulatory system allows for the effective transport of oxygen and nutrients throughout your body and the removal of carbon dioxide and waste materials away from your main tissues. In this function, your circulatory system is different from the rest of your body’s organ systems.

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:What will happen to skin pinched in something? Choices:  A: feel cold B: feel pressure C: feel bumpy D: itches E: feel clammy<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Task:<n><n>- This task refers to what?<n>- Where is a good place in a machine where lubricant be placed? <n>- What is a common reason for using water instead of oil? <n><n>Answer: Machine oil<n><n>### Instructions<n>1. <n>2. <n>3. <n>### Input:<n>A task is the activity that describes when a response is requested to be provided.<n><n>Input: What must occur to change a flat tire?  <n>### Demonstruition:<n> <n>### Response:Answer the following questions.<n>1. How a person would get involved if she were in charge of inventory?<n>2. How a person would respond to this situation if she saw her brother chewing gum?<n>3. How a person would prepare for a storm if she were the weather person?<n>4. How a person may feel if she were the owner of a vineyard?<n>5. How a person would start to put her shoes on?<n>6. How a person would react if someone told her that they would not do as expected?<n> <n>### Output:<n>An output is the desired response that a task generates.<n>Below describe the response.<n>1. The response is in the form of text.<n>2. The response is to be given using words.<n>3. The response is to have a description of at least five paragraphs.<n>4. The response is to contain at least one sentence beginning with "Why".<n>5. The response is in writing.<n>6. The response contains the number of words in the input.<n><n>### Conclusion<n>A conclusion is the statement that concludes the instruction. <n>The conclusion to the task could state something such as, "Congradulations, you completed the task."<n><n>### Further instruction<n>The answer to the task is incorrect.<n><n>The answer to the instruction is incorrect.<n><n># task<n>Below this line, put a paragraph, which will be considered the first task.<n>Below this line place another paragraph that is considered to be part of the task.<n>Now place the last paragraph to be the last part of the task. <n><n><n># instruction <n>1. 2. 3. <n><n>

The methods are void, so no values are passed into them from outside. The'solve' method is called once the 'create' one

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Jackson is a popular city name, but the one with a governor's office is where? Choices:  A: michigan B: wyoming C: mississippi D: tennessee E: mississippi<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```<n>answer: D: tennessee<n>```<n>### Response Format:<n><n>#### Multiple Choice Questions<n><n>```<n>answer1: answer2: answer3<n>```<n><n>Where A and B are answer choices and C and D are your answer.<n><n>e.g.<n>```<n>answer: C<n>```<n>which is a shorthand for, or another way of saying answer(C):C<n><n>### Reasoning:<n>The response should be a well formatted multiple choice answer that includes the response, a blank line and then answer code(s).<n><n>#### Explanation<n>```<n>Answer:<n>Answer1:<n>answer2:<n>**answer3:**<n><n>Reason<n>```<n>When a task asks about your choice of multiple choice answers, you need to answer in a single line by including the response and then the choice codes.<n>```<n><n>### Sample Responses:<n><n>Example responses are below to assist you in responding to the instruction.<n><n>### Examples:<n>Answers may be submitted with examples. Note that the examples are not part of your response code as they are not required for completion of the task.<n><n>### Example Response:<n>Here is a correct response example:<n>```<n>answer:<n>answer:<n>answer<n>```<n><n>## Testing:<n>To test your understanding of the task, it would be appropriate to see that your response matches the response example.<n><n>### Additional Help:<n>Additional help is available online in the form of videos and articles.<n><n>### Sample Response:<n>Use the response below to assist you in writing this code.<n>

Choices: A: handkerchiefB: hat C: book D: water E: jacket<n><n>### Response2:<n>The boy waited at the bus stop and the man gave him a hat.<n><n>### Exercises:<n><n>### Exploration 1:<n>What is the correct grammar of the English sentence "I'll go to London this summer"?<n><n>### Expected Answer:<n>I'll go to  London this summer.<n><n>### Task:<n>Please explain in your own words why the above sentence is the correct answer.<n><n>### Solution:<n>What are the verb tenses?<n><n>Past Tense- I'll go to London. <n><n>Present tense-  I'll go to the London.<n><n>future tense-I'll go to the london this summer<n><n>## Exploration 2:<n><n>What is the correct verb tense for the sentence "What do you do when you are free? I work."?<n><n>### Expect Answer:-<n>work<n><n>### Task:-<n>Please explain in your words why the above sentence answers the question correctly and what the grammar of the correct answer is.<n><n>### Solutions:-<n><n>Present Tense:- I work.<n><n>past tense: I worked<n><n>## Exercises 3:<n><n>### Task1:-<n>Please translate the following Japanese sentences into English using a dictionary.<n><n>### Warnings to the Japanese students:<n>- The purpose of this task is to practice grammar skills. My sister loves me.  <=> My sister loves <n><n>2. I like him.  <=> I like <n><n>3. The boy who I have seen, the boy is tall. <=> The boy who <n><n>### Solitations-<n>1. My sibling loves me

The wall is made up of blocks with an orange colour. There is a window above the wall. The shelves are placed near the wall. Beside of window is an arm chair with an orange colour. The stair is made of wooden and there is light above the stair. At the other side of stairs is a glass door.<n><n>###Demonstration<n><n>Input: How did you answer to the interview question 'What can I tell about you'?<n>Answer: It was written well.<n><n>The response of this:<n><n>It is in my hand when you wrote the application.<n><n>###Explantion<n><n>When you apply for a job which is a process of recruiting a worker in a firm or an organisation and hiring one of them, you would have answer questions during an interview as follow:<n>- Why do you see the job?<n>- What are you good at?<n>- Can you tell something about you?<n>- Describe your weaknesses (things you don't like).<n>- Tell something about your previous job?

Choices:  A: modern house B: building C: townhouse D: neighbor's house E: downtown<n><n>### Response:		____________________________.<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instructions:Complete the request.<n><n>Write a response that appropriately replies to the questioner.<n><n>### Question:Write a reply to the questioner. Choices:  A. Tell me more. B. Tell me more please. C. Yes please. D. No, thank you. E. Of course.<n><n>## Instruction:The instructor needs to give a lecture<n><n>### Inputs: The instructor and the students<n><n>### Instructor asks: ______________________________.<n><n>### Response from the students: ______________________.<n><n>## Instruction:"The instructor needs to introduce a new subject"<n><n>#### Input:The instructor and the students.<n><n>#### Instructor asks:<n><n>### What is a verb? Choices:  a: Noun. b: Conjunction. c: Preposition. d: Predicate. e: Adjective.<n><n>### Response<n><n>Write a response if the class has not been informed that this new subject is being introduced.<n><n>#### Input:<n><n>#### Questions: Choices:  a. What is a verb? Tell me more please. b: What is the predicate? Tell me more please c: What is an adjective? Tell me more. d : What is a conjugation? Tell me more please<n><n>Instructors are expected to ensure that students provide appropriate responses.<n><n>Write a reply that appropriately answers the question.<n><n>#### Questions<n><n>- What is an adverb?<n><n>- What is a noun? <n><n>### Instrument<n><n>It is important for the instructor  to encourage students to provide well thought out responses. Avoid asking "Yes or No" questions and give the students sufficient time to provide answers. Give simple multiple choice questions that can be answered by using one sentence or less.<n><n>### Reference Documents:<n><n>1) ___________________________

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Billy went away because his parents were fighting and he didn't want to stay where? Choices:  A: home team B: present C: at home D: come back E: charming<n><n>### Response:		Echo the question back to the student. Example: Which way does a baseball player stand to throw a ball?<n><n>### Sample Output:<n><n>### Input A: vegetables<n><n>### Sample Response B: Which vendor sells vegetables?<n><n>### Input B: tailor shop.<n><n>### Sample response:What shop sells the clothing made?<n><n>### input C: doctor<n><n>### Sample output: What would that vendor need?<n><n>### Inpout D: bookstore<n><n>### Sample outpout: What did they go to read?<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following questions.<n><n>### Demo: (A) Where would you go for to buy a vegetable? (B) What happens when a person says they need water? (C) When would you need to say what time  it is?<n><n>### Example (A): If the vegetable stand would need to be cleaned who would clean it? (B): If the vegetable vendor has a bad day who's job would they have to do until school started? (C): What would need an extra coat of paint?<n><n>### Ecoho: Who might you say where to? (A): When you come home from school where your siblings sit and watch?<n><n>### Output: If the vegetable vendor sold something where would that be at? (A): Which vegetable would you go ask for if you weren't sure where they kept it? (B): What would he say if he was telling a customer about the vegetables he sold? (C): What vegetable would someone say the kitchen was?

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Why would you not want to be working with wood? Choices:  A: blisters B: frustration C: being paid D: make money E: money<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**Task description:**<n><n>We are the experts. You are the client. I have an opportunity to purchase a set of 4 tickets to the local college football game. As President of the Company I can’t just use my own credit card since we are purchasing these in the Company name. My accounting department has told me I will need to get a letter on Company letterhead stating what exactly we have purchased and for what purpose. I am having a hard time finding examples of this. Help?<n><n>**Your response:**<n><n>**The letter:**<n><n>1. I, ABC, hereby request to have xyz purchased for $1,000.00. I have notated below my reasons for wanting xyz.<n><n>2. The purchase order states that x is the amount necessary to cover payment for the y z purchase<n><n>3. Please sign the following signature line confirmation to show the validity of this letter and xyz transaction.<n><n>**The letter signature line:**<n><n>ABC<n><n>Signature and Date<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:James didn't know what to do.  He felt that he'd ruin his relationship with Jen if he took it further, and he didn't want to do that.  At the same time,  He fight that pushing farther might do what to something good? Choices:  A: found B: destroy C: construct D: fix E: produce<n><n>### Response:		James didn't know what  to do.  He fought that pushing further might do what good? Choices:<n><n>### Response to the above request:<n><n>**Instruction** :Write a sentence in the past for this context.<n><n>**Instruction:** The word "context" can be the subject or object.<n><n>**Correct answer** :  He fought that pushing forward would produce something good.<n><n>**Demonstration** :<n><n>Instruction:  He felt that he ruin his relationship with Jenn if he took it any father.<n><n>Instruction: At the same time, He fought that pushing further would produce something good. This means,  If he takes it forward, then it will happen something good that will help him to improve his relationship with Jen.<n><n>The subject of "Instruction", "context" is 'the word He'.<n><n>The object of "Instruction", 'context' is 'He fought' that, and 'pushing further will produce something good'<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:A musician is most likely to perform a concerto for clarinet with what type of group? Choices:  A: music store B: orchestra C: jazz band D: rock band E: music studio<n><n>### Response:		A musician is a professional who has specialized in playing one or more instruments or working in a particular musical genre. The musician’s instrument would need oil to keep the instrument working. Oil is used to lubricate machinery and instruments. Music stores only sell to beginners. If the person is proficient they should go to a musician’s institute for lessons. Once the institute is done with the lessons they can find a concerto group to perform and that instrumentalist would need an orchestra. There are 2 types of music store: music stores that sell instruments and music stores that sell lessons.

Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: idaho B: casserole C: new hampshire D: root cellar E: ireland<n><n>### Response:		B: casserole<n>### Instructional Video:<n>[1] Install Visual Studio.<n><n>Instructions:Please open Visual Studio. A "New Item dialog box" will appear. Choose, "Project Item" in "Templates". Select "Console Application”. Give name "HelloWorldProject.vbcode". This should be the name of the project under project types in Visual Studio.<n><n>### Task:<n>[3] Create a program.<n><n>Instruatons:Drag and drop the ConsoleApplication1 form into your project. On button click event, display "Hello World "<n><n>### Task 2:<n>[4] Add a message box to say goodbye when form is closing<n><n>Instrucitons: On form close event, add the following code to class.<n><n>```vbcode<n><n>Sub Form1_Close(sender As Object, e As EventArgs)  'Add this line. <n>   MsgBox("Goodbye")<n>End Sub<n>```<n><n>### Task Final:<n>[5] Add a label to the form.<n><n>Instruciton: On button click event, add the following program to class.<n><n><n><n><n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:What do humans do when they want to reproduce? Choices:  A: eat ice cream B: have sex C: sit down D: make mistakes E: hear sounds<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: eat ice cream<n><n>### Input:(1) A: Where does an aardvark live? (2) B: Which is bigger, a shark or a whale? (3) C: Do cats like to swim? (4) D: Who flies the fastest, a bird or a plane? You just witnessed these animals in a book or a movie and asked your parents to tell what kind of animals that are. Your parents just replied "I don't know", so you decided to make a computer program to answer those questions.<n><n>### Response<n>You should write the program with four questions.<n><n>## Solution<n><n>```python<n>answers = ["eat ice cream", "have sex", "make mistakes"]<n>questions = ["What do humans do when?", "What would need oil to be...", "A: Where does an aa...", "A: What do horses eat?"]<n>for i in range(4):<n>    num = int(input("Number:"))<n>    if num == 1 and i < 2:<n>        print("It depends on the person, but...")<n>    elif i == 0:<n>        print(answers[0])<n>    elif num == 2 and i > 0:<n>        if (answers[2] and answers[1]):<n>            for i in range(2):<n>                print(answers[i])<n>        else:<n>            answers[3]<n>else:<n>    for i in range(1):<n>        num = int(input(questions[i]))<n>        if (num == 1):<n>            print("A: It depends on the person,...")<n>        elif (i == 0):<n>            print(answers[num - 1])<n>        elif (num == 2):<n>            print(["I will give up...", "It depends on the..."])<n>```<n><n>### Keywords<n>If statements<n>For loop<n>While loop<n>If/ELSE

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? What might she be a member of? Choices:  A: assisted living facility B: old people's home C: high school or college D: republican party E: organization<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```java<n>public class QuestionExample {<n>	static Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);<n><n>	public static void main(String[] args) {<n>		try {<n>			while (!sc.hasNext()) {<n>				sc.nextLine();<n>			}<n>		} catch (Exception e) {<n>		}<n>	}<n>}<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:What does moving cars entail? Choices:  A: driving B: road C: getting tired D: accidents E: ticket<n><n>### Response:		<n>1.If I need to go to groceries store but will be there for few moment and need to get back after 5 minutes?<n>```python<n>def groceries_get(time):<n>    while time > 0:<n>        print('Filling the groceries bags')<n>        time -= 1<n>        break<n>    while time < 0:<n>        time += 1<n>        print('Making purchases')<n>```<n>2.If I need to buy the clothes and need help to measure my body sizes for fitting?<n>```<n>def clothing_get(time)<n>    while time >= 0:<n>        measure = input()<n>        time -= 4<n>        print(measure)<n>        size=input()<n>        break<n>```<n><n>### 13. What does moving the cars entail?<n>```<n>def cars_move(time = 0):<n>    while time >=0:<n>        print(time)<n>        time -=1<n>```<n>### Input:I will be visiting a doctor. What's the time I should leave the house?<n>```python<n>input =int(input('How long time should leave house to doctor in minutes  '))<n>if time >=0:<n>    time = time*60<n>else:<n>    time = 60+time<n>print(time)<n>```<n>### 14. What does buying clothes entail<n>```python<n>Input =int(input('Input time in min: '))<n>for i in range (time,0,-1):<n>    print(f'Make the necessary purchases{i}')<n>    time -=1<n>    break<n>```<n>### Instruction<n>The following task asks you to complete a number of simple mathematical problems. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:What preposition do you use if you want to combine two words? Choices:  A: article B: adjective C: interjection D: conjunction E: pronoun<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer is B: adjective.  <n><n>### Solution:<n>`"A: article \r B: adjective \r C: interjection \r D: conjunction \r E: pronoun"`<n><n>#### Solution:<n>```python3<n>line_list = ["A: article", "B: adjective", "C: interjection", "D: conjunction", "E: pronoun"]<n>answer = line_list.pop(0)<n>for i in range(n):<n>    question = line_list.fetch_one()<n>    if question.strip() == '':<n>        answer, line_list = 'None','None'<n>	print(answers)    <n>    elif question.strip() == str(answer) == '':<n>        question = question.replace(" ", "").lower()<n>        if "and" in question == "or":<n>            line_list.pop()<n>        elif "and" in question:<n>            answer = "A"<n>        else:<n>            answer = question<n>        break<n>```                          <n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Some stores trick women to buy products, the sales make it seem like if you buy more you what? Choices:  A: get money B: pay money C: go shopping D: lose money E: save money<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```<n>What stores try to trick women into buying products? (C)<n><n>Women who purchase products in a store lose money. (A)<n><n>Some stores offer items for purchase. (D)<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Write a program that will provide the following for the given choices.<n><n>You may either use `for` and `continue` or `while` loop to process the below.<n>The `while` loop code in your program must have the same format.<n><n>**Note: A `for` loop is the same as a `while` loop repeated a given number of times.**<n><n>### Input<n>The code will request input from the user to test.<n><n>### Output<n>The code must output the word and phrase based on the input selections.<n><n>### Code<n>All input is taken from the console. Print output to the console.<n><n>### Sample Input<n>```<n>1. What do you call a car on which 2 seats are side by side? What is the English name of the first car that was invented? (A: two door car, B: carriage)<n>```<n><n>**Sample Output**<n><n>```<n>A: two door car<n><n>B: carriage<n>```<n><n>## Solution 1<n><n>```JS<n>function program1(){<n>    for (;;){<n>        var input = prompt('Daily life task #1', 'Example: Cut fabric at the sewing room.');<n>        if(input == null)break;<n>        switch(input){<n>            case 'cut fabric':<n>                console.log('You can cut fabric into order at tailor shop.' );<n>                break;<n>            case 'carriage':<n>                console.error('You need to call the type of vehicle with 2 seats side by side.');<n>                break;<n>        }<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n><n>## Discussion<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:What is a common sign that someone is lying? Choices:  A: ordering dog food online B: avoid eye contact C: feel guilty D: fall asleep E: blush<n><n>### Response:		You can follow these 2 steps to answer the question.<n><n>1. Take the last letter of each answer choice and make a sentence.<n><n>```<n>Step 1: Fabric is cut B, to Order, at A tailor shop.<n>```<n><n>2. If your sentence makes sense, then you are correct. Otherwise, try this method again.<n><n>```<n>If my sentence was A fabric is cut<n>Then my answer is B, to tailor.<n>So my answer is wrong because A is not the last letter in that sentence.<n>Thus I try step two again.<n>```<n><n>```<n>Fabric is A tailor B, shop to C cut.<n>```

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:A person is alone in the woods and wounded, what should he do? Choices:  A: amount to nothing B: visit relatives C: charming D: doctor himself E: cross street<n><n>### Response:		<n>B: visit relatives<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>```python<n>def read_user_input(): #input user commands to solve tasks<n>    s = sys.stdin.readline().rstrip('\n') #get user input<n>    return s<n>```<n><pre><n><n>input user input: 'h'<n><n>user choice for task: 'B'<n>input user input: ''<n><n>user choice for sub-task: 'C'<n><n></pre><n><n>### Output:<n>```python<n>import math<n>def task(user_input):<n>    user_choice = user_input.upper()<n>    print('\n\033[1m')<n>    <n>    if user_choice == 'H': #display menu<n>        print("""\<n>        *MENU*<n>        -------<n>        +1 +----------------+<n>        - Read the task and choose a sub-task<n>        ---------------------<n>        +2 +----------------+<n>        +3 +----------------+<n>        --- Choose the right option:<n><n>        -----------------<n>        + A.<n>        + B.<n>        + C.<n>        + D.<n>        + E.<n>        + F.<n><n>        +---------------------<n>        - Press 'C' for the second task.<n>            <n>        +----------------<n><n>        """)<n>        print('\n')<n>        user_input = read_user_input()<n>        if user_input == '': #get user's input<n>            return 1<n>    else:<n>        if user_choice == user_input: #verify user input and task<n>            input_task = user_input[0:2] #get first two letters of user's input<n><n>            if input_task == 'A':<n>                display_task()<n>                task_choice = read_user_choice()<n>                print(' '*36)<n>                option = input_task<n>                while option!= 'H': #loop through if the user input's the correct task<n>                    if option in sub_task:<n>                        if task_choice == option: #display choice if input's right task and choice is right choice<n>                            if task_choice == 'A': #if input task is A<n>                                display_answer()<n>            <n>            return 1 #return value if program'

"<n><n>### "So, how about you?"<n>So, as for me, it might, so what happened next?, So, that means that they've been at a time when they were worried, they're not worried now, what did

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Sally took her medicine and experienced strong side effects.  What did doctors say about the side effects? Choices:  A: great B: distinguished C: remarkable D: excellent E: peculiar<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n><n><n>---<n>### Instruction1:Answer the following true-or-false question.<n>---<n>### Demonstraion:<n><n>### Input1:Do you like to ride a bike? Input: Answer:A<n><n>## Input2:Do you like to play the guitar Input: Answer:A	<n><n>### Input3:Did you go see the movie yet?<n><n>### Expectaion:<n>A: true / false B: correct / incorrect C: yes no<n>D: any idea<n>E: all other choices<n>```py<n>answers = [ ('true', 'correct'), ('false', 'incorrect'), ('yes', 'correct'), ('no', 'incorrect'), (None, None), ]<n>correct_answers = [ ("yes", "correct")]<n><n>def check(choice):<n>    for x in correct_answers:<n>        if x[0] == choice.lower():<n>            return x[1]<n>    return False<n>```

We are waiting for a vehicle to travel by rails.<n>3. E. All the engines require an oil, but that is not the only thing that needed the oil. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:If I am forgiving, what hidden force may be activated in my life? Choices:  A: nice feeling B: good karma C: respect D: new freedom E: good heart<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**Answers**: D or E.<n>In our lives, we often get angry and upset with our family, friends, co-workers, neighbors, and other people whom we know. It occurs in any of the above situations.<n><n>When we are angry, it is difficult to be pleasant and cheerful in our daily lives.<n><n>Besides, we often feel sad which make us worry about.<n><n>But through practice, we must learn to forgive people and ourselves.<n><n>It would be helpful to understand that forgiveness is a state of heart that gives the good feelings, not a duty that we must practice like a hard labor.<n><n>We can forgive people by understanding that everybody did our best to do good.<n><n>We must understand that being angry, being upset is not right because it wastes our time and energy, we gain nothing from it.<n><n>By forgiving others and ourselves, we will gain back our good mood.<n><n>### Input<n>Whenever we speak, we also say:<n><n>In fact, speaking is an action.<n>So, speaking is something you do by saying or signing.<n><n>When you make a report, you will speak in front of your teacher, your classmates and your peers.<n>In short, speaking is an action you do by saying or sign.<n><n>### Response<n><n>**Answer**: A-speaking is something you do by doing<n>Speaking is not a word but an action.<n>You can also say: speaking is a way of communicating.<n><n>You need to be well organised before you can speak.<n><n>Good speakers like to give the important message to others by thinking first.<n><n>Good speaks are also good listeners.<n><n>A good speaker is able to catch the listeners’ attention from the start to the end of speaking.<n><n>Sometimes, you want to say sorry in order not to speak badly to another person.<n><n>To be a good speaker or a good listener, you must learn to speak and read well.<n><n>You can also improve your speaking and listening through practice.<n><n>### Requirements<n>You can use words and phrases from the topic sentence such as:<n><n>* Speaking<n>* Speaking is…<n>* Speaking is an…<n>* Whenever we speak, we can also….<n>* Speaking is also to….

Write a response that correctly describes the situation.<n><n>### Input<n>I always find a problem in every job I’ve had. My last job, the company went out of business.<n><n>### Response<n>The company you worked for went out of business. You are asked about a place and give basic information only. You need to know where that place is and its purpose.<n><n>### Request: Where is the house?<n><n>### Response Instruction:<n><n>* Write a response that:<n>  * Is at least one sentence long.<n>  * Is polite in its request.<n>  * Uses the words used.<n>  * Is simple.<n><n>### Expectation:<n>The response does not include any extra sentences that are not asked for.<n><n>### Example:<n>Where is the house?<n>  - On Main Street.<n>  - It has three stories.<n>  - It is close to the bank.<n>The response does not elaborate in its description. The response may include more detail if relevant to the conversation.<n><n>### Responses:<n>#### The house is on Main Street.<n><n>#### The house has three stories.<n><n>#### The bank is close to the house.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Where could you see an advertisement while reading news? Choices:  A: television B: bus C: email D: web page E: la ville<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer to the question, "Where could you see an ad while reading news?" is B: bus.<n>A television ad cannot be viewed while reading the news on a newspaper. Even if an advertisement is not being displayed on a television while a person is reading a news article, it can probably be seen in a movie or by viewing a television channel. In addition to B, the other answers are incorrect. "Where could you see advertisements?" - Answer to question, "A: television." Television does not display advertisements while reading the news during a news broadcast. "Advertisement on a bus": - Answer to question, B: bus.  Advertisements on a bus are displayed on the exterior of bus, not on the interior. "Advertisements by email" - Answer to question, C: email: "No advertisements are on the Web page." - Answer to question, D: web page.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:She loved buying products, she was driven by her what to shop more than any practical needs? Choices:  A: desire B: money C: time D: credit E: spending money<n><n>### Response:		<n>B: money.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>If we substitute 'the love of shopping', which is just fancy verbiage for 'lovin' shopping', which is what she is driven to do by, then'shopping' is a noun. Nouns do not change meaning by adding either '-ing' or the letters '-ed'.<n>

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:What group of musicians will include someone playing the cello? Choices:  A: ocean B: symphony C: band D: music store E: music shop<n><n>### Response:		The group of musicians is the symphony.<n><n><n>----<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Ben was an alcoholic and was in an accident.  Because of his mistake, he spent 8 years somewhere. Where was he? Choices: <n><n>(A) stationary shop<n><n>(B) 5 star hotel<n><n>(C) office supplies<n><n>(D) travel agency<n><n>(E) airport kiosks<n><n>### Response<n>Ben is visiting the airport kiosks to get some paper because only wealthy passengers are flying on this plane and that plane only has kiosks that are used for everything such as buying beverages and getting snacks.<n><n>###Input:<n>Who is a person that is wearing different types of hats? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:John came to see Sam and Sam kicked him out.  Sam didn't like company.  He prefered what? Choices:  A: you B: abbreviation C: solitude D: loneliness E: alone<n><n>### Response:		<n>A. You: <n><n>### Input<n>A book was read at the library before it was checked in. <n><n>### Response<n>C. Read before check-in.<n><n>### Input <n>A bumper was being touched up at a body shop. <n><n>## Input<n>The 6th grade took a field trip to a book store.<n><n>### Response <n>It was a B book order.<n><n>### Feedback:<n>```<n>The task was created by a user<n>```<n><n>### Features:<n>```<n>- 3 sentences with questions and answers<n><n>- 2 sentences with 2 choices<n><n>- A sentence with 6 choices<n><n>- 2 options for the user: respond or skip<n><n>- 1 instruction at the beginning and end<n>```<n><n>## Other features:<n>```<n>- There is a response form of a user<n><n>	1. 1 sentence with a sentence template<n><n>	2. 2 sentences with a choice template<n><n>	3. 3 sentences with a 3 choices template<n><n>	4. 2 sentences with 6 choices template<n><n>- 3 sentences for a question at the beginning<n><n>- 1 sentence with an option for the users<n><n>- 13 sentences for a answer (3x3)<n><n>```<n>**Note**: The following commands can also be added by selecting the task<n>	<n>- 1 sentence for a intro<n><n>- 10 sentences for a body<n><n>```<n><n># Output<n>![](output.jpg?raw=true "Output")<n><n># Code<n>---<n>## How to run code<n>1. Open the index.rml and index.js folder to create a new js file.<n>2. Put your code below the line `let code = ''`.<n>3. Select your code to get the output.<n>4. Select response form: Get the user to use their response.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: radio station B: recording studio C: concert D: tv studio E: new york<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple choice question with a true statement.<n><n>### Direction:Complete each question using the following sentence.<n><n>"It might seem that she would go to the supermarket for the following items, but actually she is going to the grocery store."<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>In the text, the author wrote that one might think that "she's going to the grocerey store."<n>However, the author did not say exactly where he or she might be going, but only that she'll be likely going to the grocry store as it "might seem."<n>It is very important to accurately answer the question with a statement that is supported from the text even when using the "might" word. You are also not allowed to answer a question with a question. Any answers that deviate from the instruction will not be accepted.<n><n>### Answer<n><n>Likely<n><n>Ex) "Likely she will go to grocery store."
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Bob thought that his Pokemon cards were common and worthless, but he was wrong about them. They were really what? Choices:  A: personal B: special C: shiny D: rare E: irregular<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### The Correct Answer To Choices `A`, `B`, `F`.<n><n>![Image of Correct Answer](images/correct_answer_1.png)<n><n>#### The Correct Answers To Choices `C`, `E`.<n><n>![Image  of correct answer](images/correct_answers_2.png)<n><n>### Explanation<n>```<n>A: The words "thought" and "wrong" make it necessary to interpret "thought" that he thought the cards were common and were worthless. The "were" indicates he was wrong and what was wrong is not given. So far we don't know what the things that are wrong are, so we assume that the cards are wrong for something to be wrong because "common and worthless" means there's a difference between common and worthful that's wrong and to be rectified, therefore the correct answer was "wrong" (Choice E or F) which had both "wrong" and "rectified" in it, but I chose the one that had the word "rectified" in in order to explain why the other answer was wrong:<n>```<n><n>```:Choices C and E had "wrong" but neither had "rectified," only E had "wrong and worthless and rectified" and C had "wrong or rare or both wrong and worthless," so one of them had to be the answer and it had be one of them. I'm going to explain it, because people aren't likely to just understand your explanation without any explanation at all. I have notified the author so he/she will understand why someone decided to downvote his/her answer. In all fairness, he/she's written some other nice explanations, I just don't know why this person went out the way and downvoted the explanation before the downvote was undone``.<n><n><n>```<n>To explain the upvote, I'll say that the author seems to get upset when people give hints, because he/she said that giving hints "doesn't count" as an answer. I don't understand why, because when I'm reading the instructions and looking at the choices, I don't understand many of them, so I ask a question that only asks about what is the correct meaning, and some people get upset and say that my question doesn't count

Task 15 : Write a program that asks for a name, a grade, and a grade rate. Then write a sentence that says, "You scored a B for the term and a C+" for this course." The sentence should use the full names of the classes and not include the abbreviation for "courses."<n><n>### Instructions<n>Below are five commands that need to be written to accomplish the task. Write the program that performs the requested operations.<n><n>### Command:Ask for a name, a term grade, and a term rate.<n><n>### Response<n>```python<n>def command15():<n>    name_input = input("Name:")<n>    name = name_input.title()<n>    term_grade_input = input("Term Grade:")<n>    grade = float(term_grade_input)<n>    grade_rate_input = input("Grade Rate:")<n>    grade_rate = float(grade_rate_input)<n>    print("Your mark for the term is {} and for this course is {}.".format(grade, grade_rate))<n>command15()<n>```<n>### Output: <n>```python<n>Name: John<n>Term Grade: 80<n>Grade Rate: 95<n>Your mark for the term was 81 and this course was 95.<n>```<n><n>## Task 16 : Write a program that lets the user guess what word the program thinks is in a dictionary. Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: jigsaw puzzle B: chess game C: puzzle box D: jigsaw puzzel puxxle E: puxxle<n><n>### Response:		Choices: A: D<n><n>### Instructions:Create a program that:<n><n>### Demaration:<n><n>### Insturctions:Reads a list of ingredients and returns all possible meals.<n><n>### Function:GetMeals(ingredients)<n>### Return:An array of strings and returns all possible meal.<n>### Example:For these lines in GetMeals([“salmon”, “apple”, “carrot”, “onion”]) returns [“salmon and carrots”,, “apple and carrots”, “salmon salad”, “apple salad”, “carrot salad”, “onion salad”, “salmon and carro salad”, “apple and carro salad”]<n><n>### Sample Solution<n><n>```javascript<n>// Create a function called GetMeals<n>function GetMeals(ingrediants) {<n>    let newArr = ingrediants.split(",");<n>    let resultArr = ingrediant.join("");<n>    let resultArray = []<n><n>    return resultArray;<n>}<n><n>// Call to GetMeals<n>GetMeals([“sal”, “apple”, “c”, “onion”]);<n>```<n><n><n>### Demostration:<n>Write the code in a file called GetMeals.js<n><n>### Demo Input<n><n><n>### Final Demo<n><n>### Solution<n><n>1. Define a function called `GetMeals`<n>2. Create a new arrray using `newArr`<n>3. Return the result array using `return results.join("")`<n>4. Add `newArr` to the result array using `arr.push()`<n><n><n>### References<n><n>- [What is the return type you would use for the GetMeals function?<n><n>- [https://javascript.info/function-return](https://javascript.info%2Ffunction-return)<n>- [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36249783/convert-array-of-string-to-empty-string-with-joins](https://stackoverflow.com%2Fquestions%2F36249873%2Fconvert-array-of%2F36342808)<n>- [https: javascript.com/the

The answer is E: England.<n><n>```java<n>Answer = input.equals("The first part... forest")? "England" : nextWord;<n><n>```<n><n>#### Part 2:"Where would the first letter be?"<n>The second part of the question involves looking at the first letter of the word given in the input. If the word began with the letter F, then the answer would be A. The reason for this is that this word is a fox while in England. Otherwise, the answer would be E. The answer is E because the fox is found in England. This answer will be printed to the console.<n>```java<n>if (input.equals("the fox is") ) {<n>	System.out.println(ansW);<n>}<n>```<n><n>####Part 3:<n>The third part of the question involves determining what letter(s) are in the word. The answer will be the first letter of the given input word.

Who sells meats? Choices: A. butcher B. pantry C. tailor D. vegetable stand E. poultry farm<n><n>Answer: B. the pantry<n><n>Question: A vegetable stand is where many vegetables are bought. Ones who buy vegetables are the people who work in a poultry farm. What is a vegetable stand? Choices: a bakery poultry farm pantry<n><n>Answer: a vegetable stand<n><n>Question: A bakery is a place where you buy meats and vegetables or pantry items! What is a place you buy meats and get many vegetables? Choices: B. pantry C A. butcher D. vegetable stand Poultry Farm<n><n>Answer: A poultry farm<n>```<n>### Instruction<n>**For each line of input: You are not guaranteed the correct input format or answer for this prompt.
