Choices: A. the butcher B. the tailor C. the poultry farm D. the customers who buy many meats E. the customers that buy much vegetable<n><n>Answer: the butcher<n>```<n>I can think of this possibility.<n><n>### Note<n>- When there is a question mark (?) in the response box then you’ll need to think.<n>- When the response for the multiple choice prompt is a multiple line response for that input in the same line then you’ll need do the multiple choice on the same line and then end with a line of your choice.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: bollywood B: record C: musical D: jukebox E: napster<n><n>### Response:		<n>This task is designed to see if the user knows what a bollywood movie is like or not.<n> <n>if (answer == "A") {<n><n>   System.out.println("That's Correct");<n>    <n>//The rest of the script goes here.<n>//Adding a movie title suggestion based on answer would look something like this<n>//movieList.add(new Movies("Sultan"), "Sultan");<n>}.<n><n>if (answer ==<n><n>if (answer!= "A") {<n>   System.out<n><n>.println("Oh, I think you mean a Bollywood movie. I can't wait to watch it at the theater soon<n><n>```<n><n>### Instructor Notes:<n>*This is the task to find a song the user is currently playing on their computer/phone. <n>Then suggest a list of movies the user might like.<n>Note: It may be better with a different title for the task<n><n>### Additional Comments:<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:After the guilty verdict in the killing the judge gave a speech, he told the murderer he was pure what? Choices:  A: wrong B: death of C: bad D: negative E: evil<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>We are making use of a few methods:<n><n>    # find() is an important part of regular expression to<n>    # find a pattern and put it into a group<n>    # preg_match_all() is another powerful regular expression to<n>    call a function of a group(s)<n>    # preg_replace_all() replace a function of a group<n>    # var_dump() print all variables on the page<n><n>    $input = 'After the guilty verdict the judge told the murderer he ';<n>    printf("The judge told the murderer that he is " );<n><n>    print $input;<n><n>    $pattern = '/(after|the)\s(guilty\sverdict)/';<n><n><n>    $arr = preg_match_all($pattern, $input);<n>    array_pop($arr[0]);<n><n>    foreach($arr[0] as $e){<n>        if($e<>'' && $e!='\n'){<n>            printf("The judge told\n");<n>        }<n>    }<n><n>    foreach($input as $each){<n>        preg_replace_all($pattern, '', $each, '');<n>    }<n><n><?PHP<n><n>$input = "My name is Paulina and I live in Houston, Texas.";<n><n>$pattern = "/(My\s[A-Z]\s\w+[\s]?(is))[\s]?(I\s[A-z]\s[1-9][0-9][0-2]\s([0-2][0-9]|30|31))?[\s]?(I)/";<n>$output = preg_replace($pattern, "<b>$1</b> $2 <i>$3</i>", $input, 1);<n><n>echo $output;<n><n>?>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Demonstraetion<n>* A/An can only be used with a singular uncountable noun (with no article).<n>* The is a determiner that is used with a singular countable noun.<n>* A/an is used to refer to a non-specific person or thing.<n>* The is a definite article that is used to give a specific person or thing.<n><n>### Input<n>where is a microphone boomed<n><n>The is used to refer to something specific that is identified previously <n>A/an is used to identify something non-specific that is also identified previously. <n><n>### Response<n>A/An is used to identify a non-specific person and thing<n>The is used to identify a specific person and thing<n><n>### Response(2)<n>The microphone boom will be positioned over specific person or thing <n><n>

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Where are a lot of offices in New York? Choices:  A: school building B: skyscraper C: business D: grocery store. E: work<n><n>### Response:		<n>We have not been to NY but we expect A, B and C to be reasonable answer. From A to C, answer A refers to a school building, i.e., an institution where children are taught. B can be a skyscraper, a high rise structure built to be used for business. C is for business, as in the business of a company or business entity. We do not know about E for now. We expect E to be an answer for the work, the work for a company or business entity or work with a specific company or business entity.

Choices:  A: lot of grief B: depression C: no spouse D: lose money E: children suffer<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Option #1<n>This type of response should explain all given information in one sentence. This is the best answer. It should explain the facts and include reasoning behind your answer. It shows that the player knows what is going on and how to relate and analyze the data.<n><n>#### Option #2<n>This response does not provide a conclusion, but a question. This may provide helpful insight for users but is not the correct answer in this type of scenario. This response will result in the end of the interaction with the agent. <n><n>#### Option #3<n>This one is too long. It should describe in one sentence everything going on. This is not a helpful response.<n><n>#### Option: The response must be the exact content in the response choice.<n><n>## Coding Style:<n>In this exercise you will start by writing code that will answer the questions with a sentence and then use a response selector to change the next input. Transportation is what I usually use<n><n><n>### Input What's the next level for you for the future? Is it an academic degree, professional, or both?<n>Answer: I don’t think they have an answer to that but I think academic for now 😅<n><n>### Conclusion:<n><n>Tell me about the last time you drove a car.<n>I drove a car a few times when I was taking lessons at school to get my license but it’s been a while now so I’m not sure what I would say 🙂 I think I only drove when it wasn’t a big deal, I would say when I had to take my tests or my driving permit test 🙂 But I think we use transportation to go from one place to the other if it’s far away or if it’s not possible to walk <n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Shane was supposed to speak at his fathers funeral.  He was a clown, and acted very ridiculous.  This cheerfulness turned off people who expected the funeral to be what? Choices:  A: solemn B: compete C: serious D: somber E: straightforward<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Example 1 - The correct answer is B.<n>> A - We would not expect a clown to speak at a funeral.<n>> B - We would expect the funeral to be solemn.<n>> C - Is not a factor in the prompt.<n>> D - We would not expect the funeral to go over 30 minutes.<n>> E - We would not expect this to happen.<n><n>#### Example 2 - The correct answer is A.<n>1. You got the answer - You got the question.  Just to make sure you know why it's the correct answer, here is how I got it...<n>> The prompt is asking about a cheerfulness turning people off. In that case the correct answer is solemn. Is not a factor in this question.<n>2. You didn't get the answer - Ok you don't know the answer, can you eliminate the choices?<n>> A - I don't expect a clown at a funeral.  I expect the funeral to somber.<n>> B - I don't know<n>> C - This isn't talking about a funeral.<n><n>#### Example3 -The correct answer is C.<n>1. What are choices that relate to the prompt in any way?<n>> A - Don't relate to a funeral, nor would be expected at a funeral. If it is there expect for clowns, I expect it not to be very cheerful, but probably wouldn't get turned off by it.<n>2. What is the only choice that isn't related to the prompt?<n>> C - I don't understand.  Is the funeral supposed to turn cheerful?<n><n>#### Example4 -The correct answer is A. We can come back to this if you get stuck.<n><n>1.  We are looking for an answer that describes a cheerfulness that turns people off.  So we are looking for a choice that shows a cheerfulness.<n>2. The question doesn't specify if we should pick B or D.<n>3. I am saying that the correct answer is A.  Would you agree?  Why or why not?<n>> A - It says the cheerfulness turns people off, which says to me that people would expect the funeral not to be cheerful. So B is not the correct choice.<n>

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Where did the person have to walk downstairs to get the tool? Choices:  A: hardware store B: basement C: garage D: repair shop E: the library.<n><n>### Response:		<n>```text<n>B: basement<n><n><n><n>Your score:<n><n>```<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Now that you have finished, try to answer the questions below:<n><n>### Demystification:<n>In each of the three input lines a word is misspelled. Can you find it?<n><n>### Answer:<n>> 1.  market => maret<n>><n>> 2. train station => train stoped<n>> <n>> 3. service station => servis station<n><n>### Instructon:<n>Write 3 programming statements that complete the following statement. Choose a statement or a conditional statement.<n><n>### Example:<n>The solution is an expression.<n><n>```javascript<n>let isInTheLibrary = false;<n><n>let user1 = prompt("Which of the places in the previous question did you have to walk downstair to get the tool?)".toLowerCase();<n>console.log(typeof user1);<n><n>if (user1 == "the library" || user1 == "liberary") {<n>  isInTheLibrary = true;<n>}<n><n>console.log(isInTheLibrary);<n>```<n><n>## Assignments:<n>1. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Sam didn't like the people he met while traveling.  What might he do to get away from them? Choices:  A: come home B: airplane C: learn from each other D: go out E: make art<n><n>### Response:		<n>I know that Sam is trying to run away from them, but he doesn't know how to. It's obvious because he doesn't have an answer to this question. It's not clear that he has gone away, so we should make clear the answer.  If he comes home, he will be home. But if he has already gone home, it makes no sense to come home because he'll have already traveled there (if not, maybe it's an answer to this question "Does Sam have airplanes?" )<n><n>### Inputs:Freddy got angry at Jackie everyday.  How did Jackie act when she told him this? Choices: A: she apologized B: she ignored his behavior C: she ignored her behavior D: she told Freddy how unacceptable he was E: she stopped doing what she was doing<n><n>### Response :How did Jackie act? Maybe it's one of B, C, E.  We have to know which one Jackie is choosing. Also, we should tell Jackie what she should do based on her answer. If she says she stopped doing what she's doing, we should tell her "That's great, keep it up!" and maybe Jackie should learn some other ways to solve the problem (maybe A, D)?

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:What eastern state is home to a mountain? Choices:  A: switzerland B: pennsylvania C: picture D: asia E: austria<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Multiple choice:<n>A: switzerland B:pennsylvania C:picture D:asia E: austria<n>#### Choose the best option from choices A+: switzerland B+: Pennsylvania C+: picture D+: asia E+: austria<n><n>#### Add an action:<n>I think that your choice is D. Why is that?<n><n>#### Add a question:<n>So what are the choices?  What are they?<n><n>#### Add text:<n>I did not hear your selection. Did you chose D because you said that you thought that that was the right answer. I would also assume that you chose A because you said that it was home to a mountain.<n><n>### Sample Responses<n>A: switzerland<n><n>B: Pennsylvania<n><n>C: Picture<n><n>D: Asia<n><n>E: Austria<n><n>#### Choose the Best option from Choices A+: switzerland<n><n>#### Choose option B+ or E+: Pennsylvania<n><n>####  Select option C+ or D+: Picture or Austria<n><n>## Resources<n><n>* [React.JS](https://reactjs.org/)<n>* [JavaScript](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/js/first_steps/introduction)<n>* [React Tutorial](https://reactjs-melissamcg.web.app/) - Making a simple calculator with react and typescript<n>* [Tour of Haskell](https://tour.haskell.org/)

Choices:  A: medicine cabinet B: medicine chest C: armpits D: grocery store E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		<n> - Option A:medicine cabinet<n> - Option B:medicine chest<n> - Option C:armpits<n> - Option D:grocery store<n> - Option E:kitchen<n><n>Answer: Answer D<n><n>### Output: The first 3 options use the selling strategy "farm to fork" as their approach. Farm to Fork is an inclusive concept that encompasses not only the cultivation of food, but also harvesting, manufacturing, processing, distribution, packaging, marketing and consumer satisfaction and well-being. The term Farm to Fork encompasses the entire food chain, covering agriculture, forestry, the processing, distribution and consumption of food.<n><n>Answer E<n><n>### Output B: Tailors are skilled workers whose specialty is making men's suits, coats and other formal wear.<n><n><n>### Output C: Grocery store supplies the food, clothing, and medicine necessary for daily life. We make 81 sales per day or 942 for the week. Of those sales, 324 were of the used vehicles and 573 of new vehicle sales. Out of the total sales of 81 car each week, 12 were repossessions. The number of people looking at the same vehicle ranges from one to four. Only the most popular model among all our dealerships was 28-48-88, the 5-door hatchback was sold to 150 customers, 96 of them bought the 9-24-11 and 78 bought the 98-33-48 model of the van. 50 vehicles are sold each week, 28 of those sold were used cars.<n><n>### Question:<n>What does this report tell you about the car dealership business?<n><n>### Demostratin:<n>A car dealership is a type of business that is involved with the reselling of motor vehicles. The business activity is to find customers, sell vehicles to the customers and service customer motor vehicles. The business has many facets, from the sales and service employees to the management team. In this report, we were instructed to make a report about the process of sells a vehicle. This report include all the information provided for the business process of selling a vehicle, the report include the average number of people who use a car sold in a dealerships, the average number of customer who purchased car insurance along with purchase of vehicles, how many car sales has dealership made in a week and the number of car sales are due to repossession. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:A person notices popcorn, cotton candy on the grass, where is he likely? Choices:  A: soccer game B: fairgrounds C: movie theatre D: countryside E: state park<n><n>### Response:		Input:<n>A person notices pop corn, cotton candy at playground, where is he likely to have been there?<n><n>### Response Explanation:<n>The person was at the playground or he might have been there.<n><n><n>### Example Response (Good)<n>To start, there appears to be a mismatch in the capitalization of the words in your instructions, and it appears that you were likely trying to ask "Where would someone be if they were reading magazines?" You have two possible answers: at the train station if they are waiting for a train, or in the book store if they are waiting for or looking for a book.<n><n>Input: Fabric in cut to order at what seller?<n><n>I believe you were trying to ask "What seller is fabric cut to order at?" There are two answers to this question: a fabric curtain shop is probably the one cutting it. The other, and most likely, choice would be a tailor shop because they cut fabric to fit a purpose so that you can sew them later or buy them for fashion.<n><n>Input: Where would one be if they are reading magazines?<n><n>I feel like you want to know where someone would be if they were reading a magazine. There are 4 possible places: at a doctor's office, a bookstore, a train station, or the countryside. I would narrow it down to a bookstore because it isn't a common place to be reading a magazine, and you're probably not going to be reading a magazine while doctors are examining you. If you could narrow it down anymore, I would say the countryside because books require less fuel than magazines do, and a book will last longer than one magazine. If that was too difficult, though, then the train station is likely.<n><n>Input: A person notices popcron and cotton candy on grass.<n><n>This one is a bit harder. It sounds like you're asking: "If they're on a playground, what were they doing there?" but I think that you wanted to ask: "Where are they if they notice popcron and cotten candy on a playground?" There are 4 places to be: on the playground, in a soccer game, in a fairground, or in the countryside, if we're not taking "playground

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:James kept a clipboard where he could easily find  it.  Where might he keep it? Choices:  A: shelf B: place of work C: desk D: office supply store E: school<n><n>### Response:		<n>Where might James keep his clipboard?<n><n>### Input answer: Answer: B: place of work<n><n>### Instructions:Submit your answer as a string to the index.php to run the command line and the server. You can do this in your browser, console, or any software you like.<n><n>### Response example:Your browser doesnt support JS<n><n>How does it work?<n><n>### Discussion:<n>* Note that any number of questions can be made in each multiple choice task, but I have created a minimum of questions of 3 for you in this exercise. The way questions work is that when a user clicks on one option, their choice gets logged in a separate table called 'choices'.<n><n>* Note. How can I display questions and answers using HTML?<n><n>* Note the question can display any images or text, if that's what you want.<n><n>* Note, the following script below describes how you can tell the computer that the user has taken the test, and how you can use an input or button to send a string to the computer.<n><n>### Code:HTML page<n><n>* Example of multiple choice question<n><n>* Example of answer<n><n>### Code<n><n>```<n><?php<n><n>function getQuestion(){<n>    //get file path<n>    $file = "data/index.php?f=".date("Y-m-d H:i:s");<n>    $string = file_get_contents($file);<n>    return $string;<n>}<n><n>function showAnswer($answer){<n>    $stringOutput = "";<n>    echo '<p><h5><b>You chose:</b> '.$answer.'</h5></p>';<n>}<n><n>function run($answer){<n>    echo $answer;<n>}<n><n>//start session<n>session_start(); <n><n>//create question<n>$question = getQuestion();<n><n>//get answer and display<n>showAnswer($question);<n><n>//create input and submit query<n>if(isset($_POST['submit'])){<n>    $answer = $_POST['submit'];<n>    run($answer);<n>}<n><n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Why is grooming often recommended to greasy teens? Choices:  A: neatness B: selfishness C: mistakes D: cleanliness E: satisfaction<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>* A: neatness: Grooming is recommended for greasy teens because of the importance of them looking good (appropriate neatness and cleanliness). This could also be an answer for choice C (selfishness).<n>* B: selfishness: Grooming is often required to appear neat to avoid the teen looking bad (inappropriate neatness). They will then become concerned with selfishness if the clothes, hair, and body odour they cannot control.<n>* C: mistakes: Grooming is recommended to prevent mistakes like a teen’s appearance making them feel insecure.<n>* D: cleanliness: Grooming is recommended and important because it could save them from looking dirty. A teen could become unhappy with their appearance, especially teenagers, and lose confidence.<n>* E: satisfaction: Grooming is often essential for a teen’s self-assurance, especially teenagers.

Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: apartment B: classroom C: buildings D: car E: audience<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>Input: Fabric that cuts to order at a tailor shop.<n><n>Input: Waiting for a vehicle while reading the books in a train station.<n><n>Input: Vehicles that require combustion engine oil.<n><n>Input: Around 100 people can fit in an auditorium.<n><n>### Assessment:<n><n>Input and Response<n><n>Input: A fabric that is cut to order at the tailor shop.<n>```<n>Correct Answer: Option B<n><n>Input: Arrive on my first visit to the doctor in early spring.<n>```<n>Correction Answer: Option C<n><n>Invalid Answer: Option A<n>```<n><n>### Example:<n>```<n>Directions: 1. Write a complete sentence for each of the following questions or statements.<n>1. What would this person like to keep away from him or her?<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a sign with some people lined up next to it? Choices:  A: bus stop B: street corner C: roadblock D: fast food drive thru E: city<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```python<n>input = 'What activity would you find students wearing white tops?'<n>```<n><n>```python<n>if input == 'Wearing white tops on exam':<n>    return 'Study'<n>```<n><n><n>### Input (repeat):Where would you park if you needed to park in lots?<n><n>### Response(repeat):<n>```python<n>input == 'On road'<n>```<n><n>### Input(repeat):Where would you keep a tool that makes light work?<n><n>### response(repeat):<n>```<n>if(input == 'In hand'):<n>    return 'Hanging light'<n>```<n><n>---<n>### Input:<n>Input: What do you find on the ground if you were going to play tennis on a court at a school?<n><n>Input: What are you doing in the middle of a road?<n><n>Input: Where would you find a road if you were planning another trip?<n><n>Input: Which item on a restaurant table would allow a person on a diet to place their utensils and food in it?<n><n>Input: The person that plays sports on a court has what on their side if they were playing alone?<n><n>Input: How tall is a fence?<n><n>Input: A person in a garage is most likely:<n><n>- Wearing a jacket<n><n>- Wear no jacket<n><n>- Lying down<n>```<n><n>## Output #1<n><n>```python<n>name = input('What is your name?')<n>```<n><n>```<n>    If name == 'Peter',<n>        print ('Pleasant to meet you')<n>        print ('Peter is your name?')   <n>    end<n>```<n>## Output #2<n>```python<n>name, address = input('What is the mailing address?').split(' ')<n>print('\n', name,'resides at: ', address)<n>```<n>---<n>### Additional Reading:<n>https://www.pythonforbeginners.com/statements/if-else-statements-in-python<n><n>https://developers.google.com/open-source/pledge/readme-best-practices

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:What does a virus primarily do to a person? Choices:  A: infect B: reproduce C: mutate D: eat food E: make computer malfunction<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: infect<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Write the method **askMe** that accepts input of name and gender in strings. The method then asks a multiple choice question. The method should write true if correct and false if incorrect.<n><n><n>### Usage:<n><n>```<n>const genders = {<n> 'male':'male',<n>  'female': 'female',<n>  'unknown': 'unknown'<n>};<n><n>const askMe = person => `Are you ${person.gender}?`.replace(/{person.gender}/gi, genders[person.gender] || "Unknown")<n><n>const person = {gender:'male'};<n>console.log(askMe(person));<n>```<n>

"To complete this statement" is where I think it should be for us to answer the question. "Who" in the sense that in other situations would be considered a who.  For example, "who is the person" could be "what's the person"<n><n>How I responded:  I believe my response was correct based on the context of the question.  I put a response to the statement in a response and not in a question. My response is, "I believe it is a location". Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: deceptive B: altruistic C: stupid D: cruel E: agressive<n><n>### Response:		<n>This response demonstrates good critical thinking. First of all, the response is thoughtful and creative, using new ideas that aren’t expected by the bot and require a deeper understanding to answer. While the response isn’t entirely correct, it’s a good response for someone who has a limited understanding of the task. This response demonstrates critical thinking, and the response also shows a limited understanding of the question. This response is an example of thinking like a human. This response demonstrates that the bot misunderstands the question, however, they know the question does not make sense. The bot might have a preexisting concept of what “Cruel” means in the realm of the bot’s prior experiences, which could cause the bot to incorrectly answer this question. Some additional information might make it easier for the response to choose the correct answer, however, there not enough information provided to the bot to correctly answer the questions.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Where would I put a rosebush if I did not have any containers to store it in? Choices:  A: flower garden B: garden center C: pot D: pot E: formal garden<n><n>### Response:		<n>I will put it in the container.<n><n>### Solution Explanation:<n>You are asked at the fabric store where do people cut to their order.<n><n>**For a multiple choice, you should always test the choices one at a time.**<n><n>If you got to the store, and the fabric is already cut to order, then the answer is E, the fabric store. If the person asks you about the sewing room, then the answer is B, tailor.<n><n>The reason why that is important for this question is that the choices are not limited to a specific type of store.<n><n>If you are at the fabric store, the option A "curtains" is an incorrect answer. That does not answer the question at all.<n><n>In general, for multiple choice with correct answers, each answer is a fact about a noun related to the question.<n><n>## Multiple Choice Questions<n><n>### Multiple Choice Question:<n>Where is the place where your answer would find the solution to your problem? Choices:  In-store solution A: home repair store B: hardware store C: craft store D: furniture store E: clothing store F: jeweler G: supermerket<n><n>### Instructions:<n>The solution is a noun that is related to your problem. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Where in your entrance hall can you keep you head wear? Choices:  A: school B: large home C: house D: hat rack E: closet<n><n>### Response:		What kind of hall is the entrance to the living room?<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple question.<n>- What part of a human's body that is covered with hair and grows from the skin?<n>- What type of machine that takes advantage of the fact that a fluid has a tendency to rise?<n>- A long and thin rod on wheels.<n><n>### Expected Response: Head hair is located on the Human Body. Hair is located on the Human Head. Gravity is located on the Earth.<n><n>The answers to these questions are all located in the human body. <n>Hairs: Human hair is a thin filament that grows from follicles in your skin. Your hair can come in colors such as white, brown, red, blonde or black. Some people have curly hair while others have straight hair. There are three types of hair found on your body including head hair and body hair. Head hair or cilia can grow on your head as well as your eyebrows. A unicellular organism contains cilia. An animal that has 3 pairs of cilia, 3 pairs of trichromes (fine hair like whiskers or bristles), 2 pairs of lateral lines (lines that can detect vibrations produced by waves and currents) and are all fish.<n>Hair grows in all mammals and birds and can come in different colors. A male cat, a male dog and a male bison will all have a mane or hair under their chins.<n><n>Hair grows from roots or follicles that are attached to your skin and grow into hair strands. The hair strand is made up of the keratin protein and hair under the human skin contains dead cells, fat cells, blood cells and sebaceous glands. Hairs have hair bulbs under them that contains pigment that gives the hair its color. There are three types, including vellus hair found all over the body, such as inside ears, hair found in genital area and pubic area as well as in armpits, eyelashes, eyebrows, top of the head and above the collarbone. There is also hair found on top of the head, side of head, behind ears which is referred to as the lanugo hair found in a fetus. The final type of hair is more coarse

Choices:  B: Move along the number line to the answer that represents the number of minutes or hours before the current time.  D: Move along the numberline to the answer that represents how much time in the future that equals the difference between the current time and the answer Choices: A: Look at how much of the number line is left, then look at the time on the clock to see if that is before or after the number you chose. What might they be watching? Choices:  A: movies B: theatre C: cabaret D: conference E: meeting<n><n>### Response:		C: cabaret<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Your program will consist of functions that contain executable commands and are organized as a hierarchical structure.<n><n>#### Important Information<n><n>The first argument entered into your program must be the student number. Your program should respond if the number requested passes the range that allows for the student(s) to be eligible to receive an item from the department of food service. For example, if the student number passed the eligibility check, the response would be, "Your student number: (x) falls within the range of people who can receive an item." If the student number does not pass the eligibility check for a department of food service item, the response should be, "Your student(s) number:(x) does not fall within the range of people that can receive an item."<n><n>The second argument entered into your program will be the department of food service the student wants (or does not want) to purchase (i.e. Pizza, Ice cream, Milk, etc.). The program must respond if the department passes the range of items. For example, if Milk passes the range of items, the response would be "Milk is an option for purchase." If Milk does not pass the range of items, then the response should be "Milk is not an option for purchase."<n><n>The third argument entered into your program should always be the price of the item purchased or not purchased from the Department of Food Service. If Milk is purchased, then the response will be "$1.25" and $ "Your total: $1.75." If Milk is not purchased, then Milk will be removed from the program as follows: "Your total: $0." "Department of food service has no additional items available."<n><n>If pizza is purchased, the response will be "Your total: $2.45"<n>If ice cream is purchased, the response should be "Your total:  $1.45"<n>Your program should always output a receipt showing "Your total: $x.x" where "x.x" is the total owed in dollars.<n><n>Your program should always respond appropriately and output the appropriate receipt in dollars for any item that is purchased.<n>

I'm having a good time!<n><n>#  Question; Can you explain a sentence?<n>Demonstration:  "Your mom doesn't read the newspaper and she likes reading the newspaper".<n>The subject of a sentence is what the sentence is about.<n>The predicate of a sentence is what is being said about the subject (it is what the sentence is "about").<n><n>Here the subject is "she".<n>"She" goes with the predicate "to read".<n>"She" is the subject, and it says she doesn't like her.<n>So it is true there are two kinds of things. <n>

Go to any store, buy some fabric and tell them to come back tomorrow to pick it up and bring the rest of your money."<n><n>

Choices: A: new potatoes, B: French fries, C: boiled, D: mashed potatoes E: hash browns<n><n>### Demand<n>1. Write an IF statement that will read the potato input to determine what potato kind is chosen. You can use nested IF statements, but be careful to not over-complicate your program or run it longer than necessary.<n><n>2. Write a loop statement, that will store into a variable the chosen potato kind.<n><n>3. Write a statement that will ask the user for a second kind of potato.<n><n>4. Ask the IF statement to compare the first potato choice with second potato choice.<n><n>5. If the two potato choices are the same, print "Choose A!" and terminate. If they are different print "Choose B!" and terminate.<n><n>6. If they are not the same, then use another IF statement to ask whether the first kind of potato is "new potatoes," "French fries," "boiled," "mashed potatoes," or "hash browns."<n><n>7. If they are not "new potatoes," ask them if they are French fries or boiled. If they are "boiled," go to step 5. If they are not, then ask for the mashed potato choice then continue to step 7. <n><n>8. If their choice is different from "mashed potatoes" then print "Choose C" to terminate.<n><n>9. If their choice is not different from mashed potatoes, then ask if they are hash browns or not hash browns. If they are not hash browns,

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:What is the opposite of hosting a crowd? Choices:  A: few people B: pay debts C: individual D: single person E: small group<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: B: pay debts<n><n>### Explanation:<n>A: few people<n>- The opposite of few people would be a crowd<n><n>C: individual<n>- The opposite of individual would be a crowd<n>- Individual means to separate something into its smallest parts<n><n>D: single person<n>- The opposite of single person would not be one that is part of, or comprising a large number of people<n><n>E: small group<n>- The opposite of a small group would be that of a large group<n><n>### Instructor: <n>I am in a need of a response from each of you.<n><n>### Teacher:How would you know that students have an understanding of the term  "tailor"<n>- In a sentence where "tailor" is used in a sentence.<n><n>### Student:<n>I would say tailor shop because a tailor shop is a place where fabric is cut to order that's cutting fabric to order.<n><n>### What kind of text do you expect student to analyze?<n>- I would expect them to comprehend what a shop is<n><n>###  How do you know student know the difference of the context?<n>- I could let students look for the word shop at a place that is being described. <n><n>### Why is it important for student to know the context of the text?<n>- Students should know the different contexts in which a word is used if they want to understand the contexts word was used in.<n><n>### Which word is the most important to understand?<n>- The most important to understand would be the context "tailor" is being used in.<n><n>

The choices are ground, human body, repair shop, combustion engines, and service station. The user can only choose one answer that will be used.<n>- Oil is applied to machinery to reduce friction. Machinery needs to be lubricated regularly because they do wear out over time. This is to reduce friction when part of machinery moves near to part of machinery or part of machinery to another part of machinery. This is to reduce the wear and tear of moving part of machinery relative to moving part of machinry.<n>- Machinery may use different oils depending on what needs to be lubricaded. Machinery may use oils that can be burnt, but these aren't used for oil to be used. The oil that would be used is the oil that can be found in car engines, and diesel engines are different form of engines. <n>- The oil used in car engines and diesel engines lubricates and cools parts of machinery that do move, as well as doing its job if needed to be burnt. <n>- Car engines and diesel engines have different needs for oil. A service station with diesel and car are in different places on the earth from where the human is. Only one would contain the type of oil needed.<n>- This means it could be a ground, a repair shop, a combustion engine, a service station, or a human body where the oil would be needed to be used. Each of these choices represents a different type of oil. One is the fuel from the station, and one is a part of machinery that applies this oil.<n>- Other than ground and repair shop, neither one use this type of oil. This is because of lubrication and cool

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Answer: D: combustion engines<n><n>### Input:Where does a beaver leave? Choices:  A: wooded area B: body of water C: the ocean D: british columbia E: zoo<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The beaver would leave the zoo and go to the wooded area if the answer was B<n><n>The beaver is being held captive and would leave the body of water in the form of the zoo.<n><n>The answer is not A, B or E.<n><n>The beaver resides in the woods and is not held captive in the zoo, therefore the answer is option C (which is an incorrect response.)<n><n>### Input for Response:<n><n>The question:<n><n>What does a person have to carry to get in shape?<n><n>The answer:<n><n>If you are a person who wants to stay in shape then a person would have to carry a ball or maybe exercise equipment depending on if they are at home or on the go<n><n>### Response<n><n>I agree with the answer.<n><n>The question has to do with health and physical fitness, not weight.<n>If a person is in shape, they will not have to take a ball or exercise equipment to their destination.<n><n>The answer I would select from the choices is exercise equipment. This is inaccurate because not everyone carries around exercise equipment or can have a ball with them at all times.<n>

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: chicken coop B: supermarket C: box D: egg carton E: henhouse<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: After bringing eggs home from the market in what are they held<n>Answer: E: Box<n>Input: After carrying eggs home from the marketplace in what are they held.<n>D: Egg carton<n><n>### Feedback:<n>* The verb to be used is 'to be'. For examples see instructions below.<n>* This is used in the question after the comma in the previous steps, 'in what are they held?'<n>* For the purpose of this example this is a multiple choice question, if it is a multi-answer question (e.g. you have written 'a, b, and c' for the answer, the answer will be "all of the above") there will be no comma after 'answer'.<n>* If your response uses any of the options listed, you must capitalise that option before using it, i.e. write 'A: Fabric' and 'B: tailor shop'.<n>* The question must have a subject, for example if you had 'Where are you?' you should use subject as 'I'.<n><n>## Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>## Demonstration: Input: Where was he if he has a flat tire? Choices: A: auto factory B: tire store C: service station D: car garage E: repair shop<n>Answer: B: tire store<n><n>## Feedback<n>* The subject of your sentence (the answer is, where was he?) comes before the question (where was he?)<n><n>## Instrucciones: Respuestas a la siguiente pregunta múltiple<n><n>## Demostración: Ingresar: Dónde compró la ropa? Choices: A. ¡Jabonería! B. Casa de ropa C. Tienda de suministros D. Fabrica de tela (Sucursal) E. Oficina de servicios<n>Respuesta: B. Fabrica de tasa (Sucursal).<n><n>## Feed-back<n>* La preposición adjetiva 'of' en el inglés debe ser precedida de la preposición 'de' en español.<n>* The subject of the sentence (the answer is [Dónde], where?) comes after the question (dónde / donde? where?)<n><n><n>## Instrucción: Respuesta a la siguiente pregunta multiple<n>##
